RVO 37.
translated:
Molander, Arvid Ragnar, PhD, Acting Laboratory Assistant, Lysekil, b. 21/3/86 in Tra-nemo, Älvsb. 1, son of factory worker Mårten and Elise Molander. Married on the 15th of the month to Rut Lundberg. Children: Barbro, born in 1916, Lisa and Beth, born in 1918, Märta, born in 1919, Bengt, born in 1921. 

Education: Examined in Gothenburg in 1906, Bachelor of Arts in Uppsala in 1910, Licentiate of Arts in 1913, trial year 1912-1913, Doctor of Philosophy in 1916. Assistant teacher in Växjö from 1910-1911, teacher in St. Mm from 1911-1912, acting superintendent at Riksmuseet from 1912-1913, acting director of Kristinebergs zoological station from 1927-1928, assistant in the Swedish hydrographic-biological committee from 1913, fisheries scholar from 1918-1937, acting fisheries superintendent in the western district for 3 years, senior assistant and head of the marine fisheries department at the Lysekil Oceanographic Laboratory since 1929, acting laboratory assistant in the Swedish hydrographic-biological committee since 1945. 

County councilor from 1927-1930 and since 1935, chairman in 1937-1938, vice chairman in 1939, chairman of the county council's finance department, industry and local history commission. Member of the municipal film board since 1931, vice chairman since 1939, chairman of the tax board, the board for national fisheries, the commission for the system book, the Bohuslän Great Sea Fishermen Association, the Storsjöfisk. sales association, and the Bohuslän's Island Fisher's Association, vice chairman of the general election association, county association and its executive committee, chairman of the local section in Lysekil. Advisor to International Oceanographic Research. Study trips to Germany, Norway, England, France, Poland, and others. Published about 70 papers in fisheries biology topics, mainly on herring, cod, redfish, flounder, and whiting biology and growth relationships. Studied animal communities in the Gullmarsfjorden, history of Bohuslän's herring fishery, wrote about 10 papers on penguins and antarctic marine mammals, etc. Received the Royal Order of Vasa in 1937.

employmentHistory.title: Senior Assistant and Head of Marine Fisheries Department

publications.name: Studies on Penguins and Antarctic Marine Mammals
